name: Sheraton Springfield at Monarch Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Went to stay at this hotel for our wedding, check in was courteous and quick even when we arrived early in the day. The room was clean, nice and cofortable. Connection of the hotel with the shopping next door was nice however there should be more options for food and shopping. Nice place to get to the computer look around on the internet. Wished we had time to go to the pool and fitness center, it certainly looked nice. Overall its a nice hotel to stay not over the top.
reviews.title: Nice Place

reviews.text: I recently stayed at the Sheraton while I was in Springfield to see a play. As soon as I walked in I was greeted by a fantastic staff. Hotel was very clean and I slept well. Decided to have a hamburger at the restaurant and it was great. Will definitely suggest this hotel to friends when they are in the area.
reviews.title: One of the best hotels I've stayed at

reviews.text: I have traveled to many countries, including 3rd world and remote locations, over the past 10 years and this was the worst hotel I have ever stayed in hands down. The hotel is set up like a prison where the rooms face in toward an open balcony. There is an open courtyard that runs from the top to the bottom floor so every bit of noise echoes throughout the floors. We were on the 7th floor and could hear guests in the LOBBY! We could hear guests running and jumping above us, below us and up and down the hallway outside our door. After patiently listeneing to the ruckus for over 1 hour, I called the front desk to complain and was told that they would send security to ask the guests to be quiet. Two hours later the issue was still not resloved. I then went down to the front desk and asked to be transferred to another area hotel. The manager asked me to stay promising me that they would comp our room and that the noise issue would be handled. Sadly, after an hour of waiting, there was still no reslove. So at 12:00am at night I had to pack up my 6 month old twins and truck ourselves to another hotel. They could'nt pay me to stay at that hotel again! It was the worst experience I have ever had with any hotel from the noisie to the terrible customer service. Do yourself a favor and steer clear of this hotel if you plan on getting any sleep.
reviews.title: I have traveled the world and this was the WORST experience I have ever had!!

reviews.text: Booked two rooms for a weekend night, one for myself and 16 mos son, another for a friend who's been sick. Telephoned front desk twice pro to arrival requesting quiet rooms...no mention made by the staff regarding the childrens dance competition being held that weekend and that all 250+ rooms were booked. Needless to say, long waits at elevators, not enough parking in adjoined lot forcing us to park a block away at night, and the noise of kids and doors slamming resonated through the hotel all day and night. The parking fiasco was dangerous and time consuming!
reviews.title: Loud
a nightmare
reviews.text: Sheraton must be booking events on weekends to fill up their rooms. We were there the w/e of 3/12, and there was a 'dance challenge' all weekend for kids 5 and up. Elevators took forever, no parking to be had in the building, so that meant walking the streets of Springfield. Did I mention NOISE? Doors slamming, kids running and screaming, food wrappers littering. I had requested a quiet room as I was traveling with an ill friend and a toddler...my friend was barely able to tolerate the long waits at the elevator, and was there a bench to sit upon?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is an old hotel, the room had a new bed but everything else was old including the TV. The bathroom was dark, not enough light to put on make up, And the exhaust fan was constantly on making a loud noise, so the bathroom door must be closed to hear the TV ! The parking garage was constantly FULL - so had to park in a parking lot down the street. Probably would not stay here again.
reviews.title: Parking a nightmare
Nice hotel for the Area - Be prepared for lots of "extra fee's"
reviews.text: My Visit to the Sheraton was a brief 2 night and 3 days stay for a college event near the Hotel. The Sheraton was a clean, presentable and comfortable stay, located in downtown Springfield. The property is an older one but seemed to be well kept. There were assorted restaurants in the mall accessible from the lobby which was handy. Room rates for the weekend I stayed were higher than I expected and nearly 3 x that the following weekend under the same booking codes. Can't speak to the internet other than it was expensive, like $15 a day which seems well out of place in today’s wireless world. Also noted that parking was another expensive fee considering the location of the hotel. Dinner at the sports bar downstairs was comparable to eating in an airport in the way of cost and value. I stayed down the street in a Homewood Suites property the week after my stay here and had a much better experience and found much better value for my money. In summary, A clean, comfortable and nice stay - but be ready for all the extra charges, fee's and expense.
We stayed here for business conference for 3 nights at the end of April.
reviews.title: Pleasant stay, but expected more of a Sheraton.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The main reason for booking this hotel was because of its proximity to MassMutual convention center.
reviews.title: Slightly under my expectation

reviews.text: Like the title says, our group expected a little more from a Sheraton property. You could tell that it had been a few years since the hotel received an upgrade. That being said it felt very clean. The rooms matched the overall feel of the hotel - a little dated, but very clean. Beds were very comfortable. We would have had difficulty sleeping if not for the fact we were really tires after our meetings - Our room faced the river (nice view), but the elevated highway made it a bit noisy in the room.
reviews.title: V nice...a la carte, city hotel

reviews.text: Stayed here one night with my family in July 2011. We checked in very late and left early so I don't have much to write about. Hotel lobby and room were clean and I thought the hotel was very quiet. Beds were comfortable. The only cons I can think of were being charged for parking and no free breakfast. I booked the room on hotels.com and got a good rate but with the parking fee and having to buy my family breakfast I would have been better off staying at a near by Hampton Inn.
reviews.title: Average

reviews.text: We were so disappointed when we arrived at the Sheraton. We had booked a room on club level including breakfast. This hotel is so outdated, it's like something trapped in the 80's! I am not normally fussy, but $250 a night I thought it would be nice. The room was so noisy, not only from the street but the air conditioning which we tuned off but another fan kept going.The decor was grubby, the carpets fillthy and tiles falling off the bathroom walls. There was a jacuzzi bath tub but I would not let my kids use it as it looked so old and the control on the wall was almost hanging off! The beds were comfy. When we went for hors d'oevres in the club lounge there was a lovely man called Jackson serving but the room was grubby. I wanted to use the internet but when I looked at the key board there was so much dirt in between the keys I felt sick.
reviews.title: Nice staff , drab hotel

reviews.text: We headed out in the evening for dinner but the attached mall was all closed at 6 o'clock! Locals advised us not to go too far in one direction as it wasn't safe! We chose Springfield as we were visiting Sturbridge village. In hindsight I would choose to stay in a motel there rather than the bigger town of Springfield. This is like a ghost town with nothing to do!
reviews.title: Enjoyed my stay

reviews.text: I feel bad on Jackson giving this a bad review because he was so good but my advice would be to try and get a job in a better hotel.
reviews.title: Stayed twice only because we had to

reviews.text: Just came back from a church convention and stayed here due to proximity to MassMutual Center. I overall enjoyed the atrium set up of this hotel; very clean and not as noisy as previoulsy indicated reviews (it does help that security walked around the hotel at night #majorplus). I loved the bathrooms, could care less about the type of tv it was. One lady at the front desk could def use customer service skills but I overall enjoyed my stay. Unfortunately the food choices weren't great (what happened to complimentary breakfast?!?!) & I'm still trying to figure out what CVS closes on a Saturday at 5pm but I overall enjoyed my stay! Kudos on comfortable beds!!!
reviews.title: July 4th Getaway to Basketball Hall Of Fame

reviews.text: We stayed here on a weekend night, and got to our room at 10:00pm expecting to be able to get some sleep. There was a salsa festival going on on the second floor, and the sound resonates all the way to the top of the hotel. When we called down to the front desk, they said the party would be going on until 12:30am. The music ended then, but the yelling and partying that goes along with a salsa festival continued much later into the morning.
reviews.title: The dorm room is a good description
Really nice
reviews.text: Although they can't do anything to fix the 1970's design of the building, the management can fix the noise issue it seems that so many people have a problem with by not booking any events past 9pm. Otherwise, I have to say I won't be back.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms have been tastefully decorated, but the lighting is miserable. The CFL lights in the bathroom take longer to warm up than they should. Bathroom lighting is something you need to have immediately, not to turn on and then come back in 10 minutes when you can actually see.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel has what appears to be really recent renovations. I looks far more higher end that you would expect. The rooms were clean ( and I'm fanatical about that). The hotel wasn't loud - but i used the fan on the heating system, nonetheless.
reviews.title: Relaxing night away gone wrong.

reviews.text: The lobby was gorgeous and NO, the parking was not confusing. Has that person ever been a parking garage before?
reviews.title: Looks great!

aka: Sheraton Springfield At Monarch Place Hotel
description: Springfield's largest hotel, The Sheraton Springfield Monarch Place Hotel is conveniently located in the heart of the city, just minutes away from several of Springfield's attractions.
